title: 103_hr1350
content: VietNow, a nonprofit corporation from Illinois, is granted a Federal charter with specific powers outlined in its bylaws and articles of incorporation. The corporation aims to raise awareness of issues faced by Vietnam era veterans and provide support for their unique challenges. SEC. 4. SERVICE OF PROCESS. The corporation must comply with state laws for service of process. SEC. 5. MEMBERSHIP. Membership eligibility and rights are outlined in the bylaws and articles of incorporation. SEC. 6. BOARD OF DIRECTORS. The board composition and responsibilities are defined in the articles of incorporation. SEC. 7. OFFICERS. SEC. 7. OFFICERS. The officers of the corporation are elected as per the bylaws and articles of incorporation, in compliance with state laws. SEC. 8. RESTRICTIONS. The corporation's income and assets cannot benefit any member, officer, or director, except for reasonable compensation and approved expenses. Loans to individuals are prohibited, as well as issuing stock or paying dividends. The corporation cannot claim federal approval for its activities and must maintain its corporate status. The corporation must maintain its status as a corporation organized under Illinois law for all activities. The corporation is liable for the actions of its officers, directors, employees, and agents within their authority. Maintenance and inspection of books and records are required. SEC. 10. The corporation must maintain accurate books and records of account, including minutes of proceedings involving members, the board of directors, or authorized committees. It must also keep a record of members' names and addresses. Members with voting rights can inspect these records for a valid reason at any reasonable time. This section does not override any state laws. SEC. 11. Financial transactions are subject to audit. SEC. 11 amends the Act to include audit of financial transactions for private corporations. SEC. 12 requires the corporation to submit an annual report to Congress. SEC. 13 provides definitions. SEC. 13 of the Act defines the term "corporation" as VietNow and "State" as various regions. SEC. 134 states that VietNow must maintain its tax-exempt status. SEC. 15 specifies that the charter will expire if VietNow fails to comply with the Act's provisions.
